page.title: 14DURLEIGH RESERVOIR
page.content: Durleigh reservoir was built in 1938 and completed in 1939 to improve public water supply.It attracted the Cellophane factory.In order to build the reservoir,17.3sq.km.of land was flooded and a dam was needed.The structural character of the dam was earth with a puddle clay core.Water is collected from 20-30miles around.Wessex Water Co.clean 3.5 million gallons a day,while British Cellophane use 1.5 million gallons per day.The whole reservoir is operated by one man,Sandford Faucett the engineer.About 6 people a year are employed.The top water level is 22m. the lowest 8 feet.Near the road are sloping stone walls,further round red mud and stones.In a fishing lodge nearby a fishing licence can be bought for Â£130p.a.There is a bird hide.The top part is a bird sanctuary.
